history.content: From what I've heard from friends who took it in the Summer, 61BL is already a ton of time invested. Unless you're familiar with the concepts already and are just taking it for credit then this is probably not advisable tbh.

children.subject:
Same as the semester. Low workload, but conceptually difficult.

I wouldn't recommend the average person take it with 61BL, although you know how much you can take.

would the lecture be webcasted? And also, what will we do in the lab (cause I have never taken classes that require 12 hours of lab per week before)? Is it mandatory to attend the lab? 

Thanks

Hello, I am one of the summer instructors for 61BL (Alan Yao is my co-instructor). For the vast majority of students, I highly advise against attempting both 61BL and 188 during the summer due to the high load of 61BL. Both classes occur during session C, so you may find the two classes competing for your time.

61B during the regular semester is already a very heavy workload course. 61BL moves twice as fast as the semester version because the same amount of material and projects must be condensed into 8 weeks. You'll be physically in lab for at least 12 hours a week, and will additionally have work to be completed outside of class time (as well as 2-hour weekly lectures and exams to attend).

I would really wish for 61BL or 188 to be your only major academic time commitment so that you have time to rest. I wouldn't want you to be stressed about school every hour of the summer.

The only student that might be able to do both would be someone who has already taken a 61BL and/or 188-equivalent course in the past but just needs to retake it to fulfill a requirement. If you already know most of the material for one or both courses, then it could be conceivable to take both at the same time. For everyone else, I would advise against it.

history.content: It is possible to take CS61B and CS188 during the summer? Any advice?
history.subject: CS61B and CS188 Summer 2016
